stream_context.summary: Kaze fixed a complex, persistent crash bug related to register overwriting. He then began completely redesigning a 'boring' red coin mission within an existing level, replacing it with a new temple-themed area and taking live feedback on textures and layout. He also discussed the conceptual design for a future level, an ice castle.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is completely redesigning a red coin mission from an early level after playtester feedback revealed it was boring and had frustrating controls.
development_findings.quote: we're just remaking one area of an old level because I have watched playtesters play it and I realized this area fucking sucks.

development_findings.summary: Kaze identified and fixed a major crash bug caused by a custom optimization conflicting with a game function that overwrote the S8 register during swimming.
development_findings.quote: I'm using a fucked up optimization that stores the current object pointer. In the FP register, which is the same as the S8 register in GCC... This function here decides to overwrite the S8 register with some random local variable.

development_findings.summary: A future level, Quest 13, is planned to be a suspenseful ice castle. The visual theme will be bright, using white and desaturated blues, rather than literally dark.
development_findings.quote: Quest 13 is going to be an ice castle. On top of a mountain. And it's going to be very gloomy and scary and dark. Or maybe more suspenseful than gloomy and scary and dark.

development_findings.summary: Kaze is drawing inspiration for the new ice castle level from a level in his previous game, 'The Missing Link'.
development_findings.quote: I was thinking like Hollow Root Keep in The Missing Link. Yes, I'm going to be using my own game as inspiration.

development_findings.summary: Textures for the game are sourced from a variety of places: ripped from other games, and created by team members Zeina and Biobak. Kaze rarely makes them himself.
development_findings.quote: I have them all from random games. I rarely make textures. I start with Red Deltarune music but I have not played either game. Oh yeah, Zeina also makes textures. I think Biobak also sometimes makes textures for the levels the team works on.

development_findings.summary: Kaze's motivation for developing on original hardware is rooted in the challenge itself, rejecting easier modern tools like Unity to preserve the spirit of the project.
development_findings.quote: it'd be pretty easy to do this just in like Unity or something but that's kind of taking away the whole spirit of the challenge of like making something that runs on n64

development_findings.summary: Kaze adjusts level geometry to prevent players from making mistakes, showing that he designs with less-skilled players in mind, especially for early-game levels.
development_findings.quote: I feel like people are gonna climb up here and then just do that. Oh, no. People are so bad at Mario 64. They do that. I need to move this closer.

development_findings.summary: Progress on integrating F3DX3 and RQIA is currently stalled, pending decisions from another developer, Sauraen.
development_findings.quote: Nope, I'm still waiting for Sauraen to make the final decisions on that.

context_findings.summary: Kaze believes that arguing and discussing topics, even controversial ones like politics, is a valuable way to learn, understand different perspectives, and become smarter.
context_findings.quote: I like arguing about everything, just because when you argue with someone, you learn more about other ways of thinking, and you become smarter, you know? It's just beneficial for everyone.

context_findings.summary: Kaze speculates on the future ethics of eating meat, believing that future generations will judge current meat-eaters very harshly, though he admits he still eats meat himself.
context_findings.quote: Personally, I think that the people that eat meat nowadays in a few years, they will be looked at as like the worst people ever. The same way we look at Nazis or something nowadays. I still eat meat though, but I think people in the future will fucking hate me.

context_findings.summary: Kaze expresses a deep distrust of doctors based on past negative experiences in both Canada and Germany, where he felt he received poor advice like taking painkillers instead of pursuing physiotherapy.
context_findings.quote: every time I go to a doctor it gets worse, so I do not go to doctors anymore. Doctors actually just give you such shit advice.

context_findings.summary: Kaze consciously applies Cunningham's Law to his content creation, believing that confidently stating something, even if potentially wrong, is an effective way to elicit corrections and learn from his community.
context_findings.quote: You know that law that if you want a question answered you shouldn't ask the question, you should just say something wrong and wait for someone to correct you? That applies to everything, including making good content.

context_findings.summary: Kaze integrates physical exercise into his workday, believing it improves his productivity and focus by preventing 'brain fog'.
context_findings.quote: I generally think that doing some physical exercise, like in the middle of your 3D modeling or whatever, is good though. Because it keeps your brain fresh. It keeps you more focused.

context_findings.summary: Kaze theorizes that intentionally creating online drama for views can be a form of performance art that critiques the audience for enabling and watching such content.
context_findings.quote: the drama becomes an art piece itself because by doing that drama and getting that many views you are showing society a mirror... you guys are enabling this behavior.

biobak.summary: Biobak is mentioned as someone who sometimes creates textures for the project's levels.
Biobak participated in the stream chat, joining Kaze in a lighthearted debate with another community member about the lighting in the Wild West level.
biobak.quote: You're getting roasted by Biobak, Lila.

zeina.summary: Zeina is responsible for Kaze's very short 'military' haircut, which was the result of an accident with hair clippers.
zeina.quote: Because my wife fucked up my haircut... the front thing of the clippers came off and she just kept going. And now there was a whole bald line here.

zeina.summary: Zeina created several new texture assets for the game, specifically signs for a 'Tumbleweed Store,' 'Koopa Bank,' and 'Milk Bar' for the Wild West level (Course 12).
zeina.quote: Zayn just did a sign for a tumbleweed store so let's see.

key_stories.title: The S8 Register Crash
key_stories.summary: Kaze debugged a complex, persistent crash caused by a conflict between one of his custom optimizations and a standard game function. He traced the issue to a specific register (S8) being overwritten, explained the technical problem to his audience, and refactored the code live on stream to resolve it.
key_stories.challenge: A persistent, 'nasty' crash was occurring when the player character entered a specific area, particularly when hitting a wall while swimming.
key_stories.process: Kaze diagnosed the issue live on stream, explaining that a custom optimization he implemented was storing the current object pointer in the S8 register. He discovered that a specific game function related to swimming was overwriting this register, corrupting the pointer and causing the crash. He then modified the function's code to prevent this register conflict.
key_stories.outcome: Kaze successfully refactored the code to no longer use the S8 register in the problematic function, which completely resolved the crash.
key_stories.key_quote: Okay, this is legitimately the nastiest crash of all time.

key_stories.title: Redesigning the Boring Red Coin Mission
key_stories.summary: Based on playtester feedback, Kaze identified a red coin mission as fundamentally unfun and decided to scrap and remake it entirely. The stream documented his process of building the new area's geometry, applying textures, and refining the gameplay, demonstrating his iterative design process and responsiveness to feedback.
key_stories.challenge: After observing playtesters, Kaze concluded that an existing red coin mission was 'boring,' unfun, and had poor controls, particularly involving 'fling vines' with a bad camera.
key_stories.process: Kaze decided to scrap the entire mission area. During the stream, he built new geometry for a temple-themed replacement, worked on texturing, and adjusted platforming challenges, even taking real-time feedback from viewers on texture choices.
key_stories.outcome: The old area was completely removed and is being replaced with a new, more visually interesting abandoned temple area. The new design is actively being built and refined.
key_stories.key_quote: This is what it was. It was cute, yeah, but it wasn't very fun. Watch how I'm avoiding the water because of the water crash just built that. When you remove it, you love it. It's boring.

key_stories.title: The Accidental Haircut
key_stories.summary: Kaze's new short haircut was explained as the result of a humorous personal accident. His wife, Zeina, was cutting his hair when the clipper guard fell off, forcing them to cut it all short to even it out, offering a brief, lighthearted look into their personal life.
key_stories.process: His wife, Zeina, was cutting his hair with clippers when the plastic guard accidentally came off. She continued cutting without realizing, creating a bald line down his head.
key_stories.outcome: To fix the mistake, they had to give Kaze a very short 'military' style haircut, which was his appearance on stream.
key_stories.key_quote: Because my wife fucked up my haircut... the front thing of the clippers came off and she just kept going. And now there was a whole bald line here. So we had to cut it short, so it doesn't look too weird.
